content.name: Disney's All-Star Movies Resort
content.virginView: At Disney’s All-Star Resorts, larger-than-life sports, music and movie icons surround the rooms as Disney's quality and unique styling is everywhere you look. All three hotels are situated close to the Theme Parks, providing a holiday home for rest and relaxation right in the heart of the action. The stage is set at Disney’s All-Star Movies Resort, as massive figures from your favourite Disney movies take a starring role— from the dotted pups of 101 Dalmations to the playful toys of Andy’s Room. The expansive main pool is inspired by Disney's Fantasia, but if you're looking for something a bit more relaxing - the hockey rink styled pool inspired by The Mighty Ducks film series might be your thing. And the theme continues in the food court as you find yourself in what resembles a grand movie theatre lobby with endless choices to curb your hunger. If being surrounded by Disney movies isn't enough, enjoy watching these films under the stars at night along with campfire activities for all the family to enjoy - a magical way to end the day.
content.hotelDescription: What could be better than three resorts in one? Disney's All-Star Resorts has movies, music and sports, so there really is something for everyone! Each resort has its own pools and themed activities going on, so you'll always be spoilt for choice. And when you decide to head out to the parks, Disney Springs is just a short bus ride away. If you want a larger than life, fun-filled, unforgettable Disney holiday, this one's for you.
atAGlance: Extra time in the parks with Early Park Entry
Complimentary use of the Walt Disney World Resort transportation system
Themed food court and swimming pools
Movies under the stars

content.name: Universal's Endless Summer Resort - Dockside Inn and Suites
content.virginView: A sister hotel to Universal's Endless Summer Resort - Surfside Inn and Suites, this hotel is a perfect blend of coastal retreat vibe with the fun and adrenaline fueled theme parks conveniently close by. Of course there are the exclusive added benefits of staying at a Universal hotel, including Early Park Admission† to The Wizarding World of Harry Potter™ and Universal’s Volcano Bay up to one hour before the theme parks open (select attractions, valid theme park admission required), plus complimentary transport to and from all 3 theme parks and Universal CityWalk. 2-bedroom suites sleep six, and are a great base for larger families to unwind after all the thrills of the day.

hotel.name: Holiday Inn Club Vacations at Orange Lake Resort

content.name: Holiday Inn Club Vacations at Orange Lake Resort
content.virginView: This sprawling resort, bordering Animal Kingdom at Walt Disney World Resort, offers so many amenities and activities that you never actually have to set foot off the resort to have fun! Enjoy 54 holes of challenging golf, 3 video game arcades, a family-fun centre, and 3 fitness centres. There is also a 12-acre waterpark with unique water features, water slide, swimming pools, and a 1,200ft lazy river-style pool, plus spa tubs. Although each apartment features a fully-equipped kitchen, there's absolutely no need to cook if you don't want to, with a choice of 8 restaurants quite literally on your doorstep! For delicious fare from Key West, head to Breezes in the West Village. There's also grilled specialties at River Island Grilling Company, and casual fare at the Anchors. 2-Bedroom Apartments cater comfortably for up to 8 and 3-Bedroom Apartments can accommodate 12. You'll feel so at home, you may never want to leave.

You'll feel so at home, you may never want to leave.

content.name: Coco Key Hotel & Water Park
content.virginView: Not only does CoCo Key offer great family rooms with plenty of space in the heart of Orlando, it boasts it's own water park too — one of the best in the area! With 14 slides, three heated pools and a state-of-the-art gaming arcade, kids of all ages can play to their hearts content all day, every day. You're also just a hop and a skip away from a myriad of Orlando attractions (including the theme parks), so there's never a dull moment! And although restaurants abound (you can walk to over 50 restaurants and shops), The Tradewinds Restaurant on-site is a great place to dine, feasting on deep south favourites, followed by amazing dessert selections. A daily entertainment program means the kids will be making friends in no time, including movies screened by the pool and interesting activities that are hosted by the hotel staff. Look for the hotel mascot CoCo in the morning and afternoon for photo opportunities.

content.name: Rosen Inn at Pointe Orlando
content.virginView: This hotel really goes out of its way to keep you and the kids amused with lively karaoke nights in the Zebras Sports Bar and Grille, last food orders are taken at 11 pm, plus there is a late-night deli, which is handy for night owls. This is a big hotel with 3 swimming pools and a family restaurant with an excellent kids eat free programme, guaranteed to help your budget no end. Opposite is the Pointe Orlando shopping area with some cool clothes shops and 21 cinema screens. The I-RIDE trolley is a convenient way to see International Drive's attractions — even better, there is a trolley stop right outside the hotel.

content.name: Disney's Port Orleans Resort -  Riverside
content.virginView: Bringing Southern USA to Florida, Disney's Port Orleans will have every member of the family constantly entertained. You can enjoy the likes of waterslides, pool parties, evenings campfires, movies under the stars, and that's just the start. The picturesque setting evokes the romance of rural Louisiana, and you're just a wander along the river away from the French Quarter at Port Orleans with even more facilities to enjoy. You can also enjoy some down time here too, and your room is a cosy retreat after a full-on day. Heading to the Disney Springs for the evening? Hop on the water taxi and enjoy a leisurely sail to shops, restaurants and shows galore.

content.name: The Grove Resort & Water Park Orlando
content.virginView: With spacious apartments that are up to 5 times the size of your average Orlando hotel room, this resort is perfect for families and groups alike. The Sufari water park is an attraction in it’s own right, complete with water slides and a lazy river, and there's also a huge indoor entertainment centre with arcade games and glow in the dark mini golf, the kids won’t know where to start! The resort feels secluded and self-contained, but you’re just 10 minutes from Walt Disney World, with a complimentary shuttle bus included to take you to the door and back.

content.name: Universal's Cabana Bay Beach Resort
content.virginView: Enjoy vibrant, retro-style with rooms and suites brilliantly designed for family-sized fun and affordability. Relax and play, surrounded by amazing iconic architecture inspired by classic Florida beach resorts of the 1950s and 60s. Two towers offer the best views of Universal’s Volcano Bay water theme park. You’ll enjoy endless family fun with two massive pools including a water slide and a lazy river, 10-lane bowling alley*, and Early Park Admission† to The Wizarding World of Harry Potter™ and Universal’s Volcano Bay up to one hour before the theme parks open (select attractions, valid theme park admission required). The whole family can stay comfortably in family suites that sleep up to six, complete with a kitchenette, or relax in one of the hotel’s standard rooms that sleep up to four. You're just a short walk to Universal's Volcano Bay and a quick, free shuttle ride to Universal Studios Florida and Universal's Islands of Adventure, as well as Universal CityWalk entertainment complex.
content.hotelDescription: Experience the excitement of Universal Orlando Resort in a whole new way at Universal’s Cabana Bay Beach Resort, with more rooms and more fun for less.

content.name: Disney's All-Star Music Resort
content.virginView: At Disney’s All-Star Resorts, larger-than-life sports, music and movie icons surround the rooms as Disney quality and unique styling are everywhere you look. All three hotels are situated close to the Theme Parks, providing a holiday home for rest and relaxation right in the heart of the action. Disney’s All-Star Music Resort will get your toes tapping with pools shaped like a guitar and a piano, plus its five music-themed hotel areas—dedicated to country, jazz, Broadway, calypso and rock ‘n’ roll—are adorned with a massive juke box and giant instruments. Dining consists of colourful marketplace food court with options ranging from tasty finger food to hot meals, or just grab a sandwich and a beer by the Calypso pool from the Singing Spirits Bar. You'll certainly be in high spirits at this hotel.

content.name: Disney's Pop Century Resort
content.virginView: A sure family favourite, Disney's Pop Century celebrates fads of the 1950s through to the 90s. There's something for everyone here - you'll love the themed pools, complete with water jets, and you can dine in a relaxed fashion at the food court. When the night rolls around, enjoy movies under the stars, or head to the games arcade for an evening of laughs before heading to your room. And when you're ready to hit the parks, hop on the Skyliner, a gondola that gives you amazing birds-eye views while taking you to Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studios.

content.name: Rosen Inn International
content.virginView: The Rosen Inn International is situated in the heart of International Drive, the main entertainment centre in Orlando, so it's in a great location to explore the shops, bars and restaurants that line this popular road. It's also ridiculously easy to find, as it's next to the world's largest McDonalds! On top of that, it is just a 5 minute drive to Universal Orlando Resort™ with all those fantastic roller coasters, special effects and 3D rides. Full-on buffet breakfasts and dinners are served in the hotel's Fountain View Restaurant, and they have some very special discounts, exclusively for you. There's also a Lite Bite Deli for a snack on the run. The rooms have a modern and fresh new look whilst keeping that much needed comfort at the end of the day. Including a fridge, microwave and coffee maker, you can store your own refreshing cold drinks and make snacks for hungry kids! There are two swimming pools just waiting for you to leap into after a hard day exploring the theme parks.

content.name: Disney's Caribbean Beach Resort
content.virginView: Bringing the Caribbean to Florida, you can expect endless fun at Disney's Caribbean Beach. Split into 5 islands: Barbados, Jamaica, Martinique, Trinidad and Aruba, you can expect loads of pools to relax in, and so much for little ones to do. Head to one of the lively markets, chill at the beach surrounding the lake, or spend a few hours at the Fuentes del Morro pool, with slides galore, water cannons, and a shipwreck play area. Heading to the parks couldn't be easier - jump aboard the Skyliner gondola and you'll be in Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studios in no time!

content.name: Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge
content.virginView: The adventure of a jungle safari comes alive right before your eyes at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge. With lush surroundings and beautiful savannahs, you'll be transported to another world when you step through the front doors. From restaurants, viewing platforms, and possibly even your room, you can watch zebra, giraffes and gazelles roam free and graze in their natural environments. Little ones can learn more about the fascinating animals, and even be a junior researcher for a day. And when you're not watching the animals in awe, you can take a dip in one of the pools, feast on some good food, or hit the parks in a matter of minutes! The adventure never ends here.

content.name: Embassy Suites by Hilton Orlando Sunset Walk
content.virginView: Embassy Suites by Hilton Orlando Sunset Walk is a fantastic place to stay if you want a mix of comfort and fun. The suites are spacious and perfect for families, with separate living areas that give everyone room to spread out. You'll love the free breakfast each morning and the evening reception with drinks and snacks. Plus, being in the Sunset Walk complex means you're just steps away from great dining, shopping, and entertainment. It's a great spot to relax and enjoy everything Orlando has to offer.

content.name: Disney's Coronado Springs Resort
content.virginView: Sat on the lakeside, Disney's Coronado Springs will treat you to relaxed vibes, as well as fun for all the family. Little ones (and big kids!) will love the huge waterslide, and be sure to catch a movie under the stars when the night rolls in. Head to one of the many restaurants and savour some delicious Spanish and Mexican dishes. You're close to a number of Disney World parks here, so those adrenaline-filled days out are just a short few moments away.

content.name: Delta Hotels by Marriott Orlando Celebration
content.virginView: Fountains and falls, lush gardens, and fun for everyone is what you’ll find at the Delta Hotels by Marriott Orlando Celebration. Little ones will love the pools, complete with water slide of course! There’s even a games room, tennis courts, and volleyball to keep you entertained. And if that’s not enough, you can be at Walt Disney World Resort within 5 minutes, meaning you’ll be zooming around those rides and coasters in no time.
content.hotelDescription: Fountains and falls, lush gardens, and fun for everyone is what you’ll find at the Delta Hotels by Marriott Orlando Celebration. Little ones will love the pools, complete with water slide of course!

hotel.name: Disney's Port Orleans Resort - French Quarter
hotel.boardBasis: FREE Disney Quick Service Dining Plan

content.name: Disney's Port Orleans Resort - French Quarter
content.virginView: Bringing Southern USA to Florida, Disney's Port Orleans will have every member of constantly entertained. You can enjoy the likes of waterslides, evenings campfires, movies under the stars, and that's just the start. Revel in the romance of New Orleans' famous French Quarter, and you're just a wander along the river away from the Riverside at Port Orleans with even more facilities to enjoy. Back in the French Quarter be sure to enjoy the live entertainment and sounds of jazz at Scat Cat's Club. And you don't have to wait until the evening for a bit of music - Mardi Grogs is sure to be playing some tunes poolside at the Doubloon Lagoon. Heading to the Disney Springs for the evening? Hop on the water taxi and enjoy a leisurely sail to shops, restaurants and shows galore.
content.hotelDescription: Bringing Southern USA to Florida, Disney's Port Orleans will have every member of constantly entertained. You can enjoy the likes of waterslides, pool parties, evenings campfires, movies under the stars, and that's just the start. You can also enjoy some down time here too, and your room is a cosy retreat. Heading to the parks? Hop on the water taxi and enjoy a leisurely sail before the adventure begins.

hotel.name: Wyndham Garden Lake Buena Vista Disney Springs Resort

content.name: Wyndham Garden Lake Buena Vista Disney Springs Resort Area
content.virginView: Wyndham Garden Lake Buena Vista Disney Springs Resort Area is located within walking distance of Disney Springs®, an excellent choice to enjoy all 150 shopping, dining, and entertainment outlets on offer. You’ll also have scheduled daily shuttle service to all four Walt Disney World® theme parks just a short distance away. After an exciting day at the most magical place on Earth, you can rest up in the comfort of your newly renovated room, with beautiful views of the lake or the tropical courtyard and feel the warm Florida breeze.
content.hotelDescription: Located within walking distance of Disney Springs™, the Wyndham Garden Lake Buena Vista provides a great base in a great location with entertainment, dining and shopping right on your doorstep. As part of the Wyndham Lake Buena Vista Resort, it shares the wide range of facilities including an aquatic playground and swimming pool with a spacious sundeck area and sporting activities such as tennis and basketball.

content.name: Lake Buena Vista Village Resort & Spa
content.virginView: The Lake Buena Vista Resort Village & Spa has fast become a firm favourite with guests, thanks to its supreme location and first-class amenities. Guests can enjoy condominium-style accommodation with all the comforts and conveniences of home. Your private patio or balcony is the perfect place to unwind with a pre-dinner drink, admiring the beautiful sunset in the distance. You are only minutes from the theme parks with Walt Disney World Resort in one direction and Universal Orlando Resort™ in the other — a convenient area to be when staying in the famous fun-filled destination of Orlando, Florida!

content.name: Orlando Area Villas
content.virginView: The Orlando allocation on arrival villas have everything you’ll need for a true Floridian vacation. With a full kitchen, dining and living areas, and a private screened pool, you won’t need to leave the comforts of the home if you don’t want to. And when it comes to exploring Orlando, you’re within 27 miles of the famed theme parks, and just a short drive to local shops and supermarkets.
content.hotelDescription: A home-from-home, the Orlando Select Villas have everything you’ll need for a true Floridian vacation.

content.name: Disney's Art of Animation Resort
content.virginView: We all know and love those Disney classics - The Lion King, Finding Nemo, Cars, The Little Mermaid - and Disney's Art of Animation is where you'll find inspiration from each of them. From themed swimming pools to family suites with themed decor, there's something for everyone here. Be sure to check out The Big Blue Pool, complete with water jets and a play area for little ones. And after those busy days in the parks, order a pizza (or two!) to your room.

content.name: Bahama Bay Resort
content.virginView: This Caribbean-style resort is right on the banks of the picturesque Lake Davenport and it's laid out over 70 acres of landscaped gardens, making it a truly beautiful place to stay. It even has its own beach on the banks of the lake! The apartment-style condos are exceptionally well equipped and you'll really have no need to eat out, but if you don't want to cook there's a great restaurant on site. This resort is a fantastic place to be if you're the sporty type, with volleyball, basketball, tennis to contend with. Kids will love the playroom and games arcade, while adults can relax and listen to soft Caribbean music by the pool, or take advantage of the fabulous new spa, offering a myriad of treatments and a fitness centre to boot. At the end of the day, the clubhouse balcony is an ideal spot to watch the Disney fireworks light up the sky.
content.hotelDescription: This picturesque Caribbean-style resort sits right on the banks of Lake Davenport in 70 acres of landscaped gardens.
atAGlance: 15-min Drive to Walt Disney World Resort

hotel.name: Wyndham Lake Buena Vista Disney Springs Resort Area

content.name: Wyndham Lake Buena Vista Disney Springs Resort Area
content.virginView: Wyndham Lake Buena Vista Disney Springs Resort Area is an official Disney World® Hotel so you’ll be right near all the action. Just opposite Disney Springs®, this prime location offers you over 150 shops, restaurants and attractions for you to explore. You’ll also be only a short distance away from the likes of Magic Kingdom and Hollywood Studios so you'll be in the queues for the latest rides in no time. This resort also has its own aquatic area, with two pools, a jacuzzi and water playground for the little ones, or visit the courts and try your hand at basketball or sand volleyball. There’s so much to do, you’ll never be short of fun and excitement.
content.hotelDescription: Located in the Disney Springs™ area, the popular Wyndham Lake Buena Vista Resort offers a wide range of facilities including an aquatic playground and swimming pool with a spacious sundeck area and sporting activities such as tennis and basketball.
atAGlance: Complimentary transportation to Disney Parks

hotel.name: Sonesta ES Suites Orlando - International Drive

content.name: Sonesta ES Suites Orlando - International Drive
content.virginView: Recently renovated, Sonesta ES Suites Orlando-International Drive offers a convenient location across from the ICON Park Wheel and close to all of central Florida’s attractions.  With a fresh modern appeal, all guest suites, public spaces, and dining options have been completely updated.  The hotel offers apartment-style one and two bedroom suites (sleeping up to 6-8 guests), a quick service eatery featuring fresh breakfast items and select Starbucks products for purchase, WiFi access in all suites and public areas, onsite fitness room, heated swimming pool, colorful courtyard seating areas, business services, a shuttle to Walt Disney World and Universal Orlando, and an adjacent I-Ride Trolley Stop which provides transportation to Sea World, Aquatica, and the Orlando Premium Outlets. Guests appreciate this contemporary hotel near restaurants, shops, and attractions easily within walking distance
content.hotelDescription: Newly re-imagined with updated guest suites and public areas, Sonesta ES Suites Orlando-International Drive offers a fresh modern look throughout this courtyard style hotel.  This all-suite hotel is perfect for families – with modern apartment-style suites that easily accommodate 6-8 guests and a central location in the International Drive Resort Area right across from the ICON Park Wheel.
atAGlance: Excellent location on International Drive
Complimentary self-parking
Complimentary shuttle to Walt Disney World and Universal Orlando;

hotel.name: Loews Sapphire Falls Resort at Universal Orlando

content.name: Loews Sapphire Falls Resort at Universal Orlando
content.virginView: Loews Sapphire Falls at Universal Orlando Resort will take you to a paradise in the heart of the tropics. Blue waterfalls cascade over lush grounds, and in the distance the calming sounds of steel drums call you to take in the scenic water views. Ease into ‘island time’ and let go. Kids will love the pool, complete with water slide, games, and somewhere to grab some food without stepping too far from the lounger. And when it’s time to go and explore the parks, you’ll enjoy exclusive benefits like Early Park Admission† to The Wizarding World of Harry Potter™ and Universal’s Volcano Bay (select attractions, valid theme park admission required), and complimentary transport to Universal's 3 theme parks and Universal CityWalk via water taxi and shuttle bus. It's a great way to experience all that Universal Orlando Resort has to offer.

content.name: Rosen Shingle Creek
content.virginView: This isn’t just a holiday resort, it’s a world in itself. For starters, there’s the 18-hole golf course and 4 heated outdoor pools. The Spa at Shingle Creek is perfect for a pamper, and there's fun for all the family with tennis, basketball and sand volleyball games galore. When hunger calls, head to one of the many restaurants and choose from a range of cuisines, or head out onto I-Drive for some classic American diners. Just a short drive from Orlando's best theme parks, you're never far from the fun. And once the day is done, head to your relaxing room for some down time before another day of adventure ahead.

content.name: Disney's All-Star Sports Resort
content.virginView: At Disney’s All-Star Resorts, larger-than-life sports, music and movie icons surround the rooms as Disney quality and unique styling are everywhere you look. All three hotels are situated close to the Theme Parks, providing a holiday home for rest and relaxation right in the heart of the action. A haven for sports fans, Disney’s All-Star Sports Resort boasts five sports-themed hotel areas (baseball, football, basketball, tennis and surfing), each anchored with a massive two-storey sports icon. Kids will love the Grand Slam Pool, shaped like a baseball diamond, where the Goofy fountain will cool anybody off after a morning in the park. You won't miss any major sporting events here either - watch on one of the many screens whilst you're grabbing a bite to eat in the food court!
content.hotelDescription: What could be better than three resorts in one? Disney's All-Star Resorts has movies, music and sports, so there really is something for everyone! Each resort has its own pools and themed activities going on, so you'll always be spoilt for choice. And when you decide to head out to the parks, Disney Springs is just a short bus ride away. If you want a larger than life, fun-filled, unforgettable Disney holiday, this one's for you.
atAGlance: Extra time in the parks with Early Park Entry
Complimentary use of the Walt Disney World Resort transportation system
Sports themed food court and swimming pools
Movies under the stars

content.name: Balmoral Resort
content.virginView: A private resort, Balmoral Resort offers high-end homes with everything you might possibly need from a home-away-from-home. There’s the clubhouse, home to a restaurant, bar, and entertainment, leading out to a zero-entry pool, hot tub, and splash area with water cannons and slides. Back in your villa, there’s a full kitchen and your own private pool, so you really don’t have to head out if you can’t pull yourself away. And when it comes to heading out to Orlando, you’re within 22 miles of the theme parks. You’ll be on those loop-the-loops in no time.
content.hotelDescription: Balmoral at Waters Edge – regal by name, regal by nature. A private resort, with high-end homes with everything you might possibly need from a home-away-from-home.
atAGlance: 3 to 6 bedroom villas

content.name: Vista Cay Resort by Millenium
content.virginView: Fun for all the family? Check. Apartments and townhouses with heaps of room? Check. Your stay at Vista Cay Resort can be as relaxing or action-packed as you make it. Your apartment or townhouse has a kitchen, balcony, living and dining area, and multiple bedrooms and bathrooms. Head to the pool bar in the warmer months and enjoy a cocktail and a bite to eat, and take the plunge into one of the pools to cool off. There’s even a sports court, games arcade and a kids’ playground, so little ones will be kept busy every minute of the day. And when it comes to heading to the parks, you’re just a 15-minute drive to Walt Disney World Resort and 10 minutes to Universal Studios.

content.name: Walt Disney World Dolphin
content.virginView: Perched overlooking the gardens leading to Epcot, the Walt Disney World Dolphin is a fantastic base to make the most of the famed theme parks - you're even within walking distance of Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge at Disney's Hollywood Studios so you can explore a galaxy far, far away. With Walt Disney World Swan and Swan Reserve adjacent, there’s 23 restaurants between the resorts for you to enjoy. And with 6 pools, a waterslide, a kids’ camp and mini-golf nearby, little ones will be entertained to high heavens.
content.hotelDescription: Perched overlooking the gardens leading to Epcot, the Walt Disney World Dolphin is a fantastic base to make the most of the famed theme parks. With Walt Disney World Swan adjacent, there’s 18 restaurants between the two resorts for you to enjoy. And with 5 pools, a waterslide, a kids’ camp and mini-golf nearby, little ones will be entertained to high heavens.

content.name: Rosen Inn Lake Buena Vista
content.virginView: We think the Rosen Inn Lake Buena Vista offers excellent value as well as being so close to Disney. In the 23 acres of landscaped grounds is a lake which is home to a variety of Floridian bird life. You will find all the great family amenities in your room, just beware you may just get too comfortable! There are some great deals in the family restaurant here, and a free shuttle bus will take you to the four Walt Disney World Resort theme parks. Disney springs is very close too — with a fantastic array of restaurants, bars and shops there.

content.name: Loews Royal Pacific Resort at Universal Orlando
content.virginView: Prepare to be transported to the South Seas when you arrive at Loews Royal Pacific Resort, and experience the wonder of enchanted islands such as Fiji, Bali and Hawaii without sailing halfway around the globe. Little ones will love it here — with a water play area, Kids’ Camp*, poolside games, and even character dining. And when it’s time to head to the parks, you’ll benefit from free transportation, complimentary Universal Express Unlimited** to skip the regular queues in Universal Studios Florida and Universal’s Islands of Adventure (valid theme park admission required), priority dining seating, and even Early Park Admission† to The Wizarding World of Harry Potter™ (valid theme park admission required, select attractions), and select attractions at Volcano Bay water park.

content.name: Hard Rock Hotel at Universal Orlando
content.virginView: As soon as you step through the front door of the Hard Rock Hotel®, you’ll feel like a rock ‘n’ roll icon. With little musical touches throughout the corridors and on the walls, you’ll be transported to Rockstar heaven. When it comes to the fun part there’s a huge pool, a sandy beach, and even water jets and a slide pool-side. But the music hasn’t been forgotten — dip your head under the water and hear the beat. You’re not far from the parks, and you also get exclusive benefits thrown in including free Universal Express Unlimited ride access**, allowing you to skip the regular lines in Universal Studios Florida and Universal’s Islands of Adventure all day, as well as Early Park Admission† to The Wizarding World of Harry Potter™ and Universal’s Volcano Bay (select attractions, valid theme park admission required).

content.name: Disney's Beach Club Resort
content.virginView: Situated on a sparkling 25-acre lake near Disney’s Hollywood Studios and just a leisurely stroll from EPCOT, discover the casual elegance of this charming, New England-style Resort hotel. Disney's Beach Club Resort shares a host of amenities with it's more formal sister, Disney's Yacht Club Resort. Most noticeable of these is the mini water park Stormalong Bay, featuring a sand bottom pool, water slides, a lazy river and whirlpools - keeping the little ones happy when you're not at the parks, and giving you time to chill in the sun too. Why not reserve a poolside cabana for extra comfort, or head to Hurricane Hanna's for a frosty beverage! There's loads of other dining options for the family to enjoy too, with a highlight being the character breakfast at Cape May Cafe. At this hotel you're located right next to the marina where, in addition to renting boats to sail around Crescent Lake, you can board a ferryboat for direct transportation to EPCOT, Disney’s Hollywood Studios, and Disney’s BoardWalk. It's worth looking at the options to upgrade to a club level room for access to the lounge with refreshments available throughout the day.
content.hotelDescription: Home to perhaps the best pool complex at Walt Disney World Resort, this is bound to be a sure-fire hit with the kids! There are over three acres of watery fun to get to grips with, featuring a waterslide and whirlpools galore.
atAGlance: Extra time in the parks with Early Park Entry
Complimentary use of the Walt Disney World Resort transportation system
Waterslides and whirlpools
Close to Epcot and BoardWalk

content.name: Sheraton Vistana Villages
content.virginView: At this impressive resort on the quieter, southern end of International Drive you can choose from either a One or Two Bedroom Apartment. These beautifully decorated apartments are just a 5-mile drive from Walt Disney World Resort and only around a 15-minute drive from Universal Orlando Resort™. When you are not sampling the delights of the parks, you can choose between three swimming pools including one with a cool pirate ship, waterfalls and rocks. Or enjoy tennis, table tennis or one of the many other pursuits available. There are organised activities for kids, too. Food wise, you'll find a lovely coffee shop and deli as well as the Breeze Bar and Grill which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.
content.hotelDescription: These beautifully decorated apartments have a brilliant choice of three swimming pools! One has a cool pirate ship, plus there is tennis, table tennis and organised activities for everybody.
atAGlance: 1- and 2-Bedroom Apartments

hotel.name: Springhill Suites - In Marriott Village at Lake Buena Vista

content.name: Springhill Suites - In Marriott Village at Lake Buena Vista
content.virginView: The Marriott Village is a wonderful combination of 3 quality hotels in 1 resort, giving you the benefit of facilities at all 3 hotels for 1 great price! Each hotel gives you a different experience, with the SpringHill Suites offering studio apartment feel with a combined bedroom and living area, great for families and the extra space means you won't feel like you're on top of each other. There is complimentary shuttle access to selected parks, and a free buffet breakfast to fuel the whole family before a day exploring. The superb dining and entertainment choices of Lake Buena Vista and Disney Springs are only minutes away, while the resort has its own Village Marketplace Food Court should you not feel like venturing out. Whichever hotel you decide best suits you, you'll know that you're in a great location near to both Walt Disney World Resort and Universal Orlando® Resort, with one of Florida's best premium outlet malls on your doorstep!
content.hotelDescription: The Marriott Village is a wonderful combination of 3 quality hotels in 1 resort, giving you the benefit of facilities at all 3 hotels for 1 great price! Each hotel gives you a different experience, with the Fairfield Inn providing a quality stay for those looking for great value, the Courtyard by Marriott offering a higher standard of furnishings and comfort, while the SpringHill Suites have more of a studio apartment feel with a combined bedroom and living area.

content.name: Disney's Grand Floridian Resort & Spa
content.virginView: Disney's Grand Floridian Resort & Spa is the crème de la crème of the Disney Resort hotels. Here, the entire family can enjoy Disney at its grandest, with lavish, turn-of-the-century décor, spectacular views and impeccable service to pamper your every whim. Make sure the kids take an afternoon siesta as every night the Electrical Water Pageant, a floating, lighted procession of 'sea creatures' takes place on Bay Lake and is an event not to be missed! There is also fine dining to be had in Victoria & Albert's restaurant, complete with your own personal butler service! The world-class spa offers all kinds of divine treatments or head to the lake for a spot of sailing.
content.hotelDescription: Disney's Grand Floridian Resort & Spa is the crème de la crème of the Disney Resort hotels. Here, the entire family can enjoy Disney at its grandest, with lavish, turn-of-the-century décor, spectacular views and impeccable service to pamper your every whim.

content.name: Disney's Wilderness Lodge
content.virginView: The wilderness has never been more wonderful than at Disney's Wilderness Lodge! The majesty and grandeur of the great American Northwest echo throughout this relaxing mountain retreat and will appeal to every member of the family. Bubbling springs, authentic Native American carvings and an inspiring décor take you back in time to the historic national park lodges of yesteryear. Scenic wonders are everywhere, from fantastically themed restaurants to an amazing geyser faithfully shooting water 12-storeys high every hour! The kids will love the totem pole in the lobby, carved with all their favourite Disney characters. In fact, there's endless fun to be had here for everyone, both day and night!

content.name: Championsgate
content.virginView: The perfect combination of resort facilities, and independent living awaits you at Championsgate Resort. Staying here gives you membership to the Oasis clubhouse and the wide range of facilities it offers - most notably the water park complete with lazy river and slides that will keep the little ones entertained for hours. When you're looking for a bit more peace and quiet, retire to your upscale villa and lay by your private pool or plunge pool, an area that's ideal for BBQ nights and lazy breakfasts' in the sun. You're just a short drive away from the attractions and theme parks of Orlando so whatever you're after, it's at easy access! The modern kitchen will have you feeding the family in no time, but if you're not up to it after a day at the parks, the clubhouse features a restaurant and bar that will leave you pleasantly full. The Championsgate development is known for it's golf course so whether it's a bit of fun at the driving range, or a fully competitive 18-hole round, there's something for all abilities.
atAGlance: 4-9 bedroom villas available

content.virginView: Set amongst the attractions and entertainment district of International Drive, this award-winning hotel offers a wide range of eateries including fine dining in Jack's Place and buffet breakfast in Cafe Matisse. There's an excellent outdoor heated swimming pool (perfect for an early morning reviver) and the rooms are superbly equipped, offering plenty of modern amenities. Opposite the hotel is Pointe Orlando with an array of shops, bars, restaurants and 21 cinema screens!

content.name: Disney's Contemporary Resort
content.virginView: The closest hotel to the Magic Kingdom Park is the height of retro, '70s cool. The monorail enters the lobby through a 'curtain' of air to drop off and pick up. The stylish, gourmet 15th-floor California Grill restaurant offers incredible bird's-eye views over the Magic Kingdom Park (perfect for the evening fireworks), or you can meet your favourite characters in Chef Mickey's Restaurant. If you're not at the park during the day, there's a big swimming pool, tennis courts and even the option of renting a boat and cruising around Bay Lake and Seven Seas Lagoon - and come the end of the day, tired parents can revive themselves in the cocktail lounge.

content.name: Walt Disney World Swan
content.virginView: Next to the Walt Disney World Dolphin and the Swan Reserve, you’ll be wowed by what’s on offer across these three resorts. With 23 places to eat and drink, a spa, plus 6 pools, there’s loads of room for some well-deserved R&R. When it comes to fun-filled adventure, you’re just a short stroll from Disney’s Boardwalk and within walking distance of EPCOT and Disney's Hollywood Studios. When you're not spending those early mornings and late evenings in the park, there's a waterslide, a kids’ club, games on the beach, and even mini-golf nearby to keep the family entertained, all in the heart of the most magical place on earth.

content.name: Rosen Inn
content.virginView: The Rosen Inn is just a mile from Universal Orlando Resort™, perfectly located for fans of thrill rides like the Incredible Hulk Coaster® and Harry Potter and the Forbidden Journey™. If you are a non-driver, the hotel operates an excellent complimentary scheduled shuttle service to select theme parks. The Palms Dining Room provides a great value breakfast buffet for families, Shogun Japanese steakhouse serves delicious cuisine and Sakura Sushi Bar featuring freshly-prepared sushi rolls, nigari and sashimi served in an intimate setting. For an early evening reviver, The International Pub is on hand with a suitably global array of cocktails and American cuisine. Nearby attractions include the I Drive 360, Madame Tussauds wax museum, and Pirates Adventure Dinner Show — an experience well worth checking out.

content.name: Disney's Polynesian Village
content.virginView: Tropical gardens, lavish luaus and calm waves characterise Disney's Polynesian Village Resort. Gentle people, laughter and good cheer help every member of the family to capture that laid-back South Pacific mood in no time at all. Rooms are airy and have a tropical feel with bamboo and wood décor. When exploring the resort, tell the kids to look out for the unique Kukai Nut tree. The only one of its kind in the state of Florida, the tree was brought to the Walt Disney World Resort from its native Hawaii. The hotel is on the monorail system that will whizz you to the Magic Kingdom Park.

content.name: Disney's BoardWalk Inn
content.virginView: This magical waterfront property will take you back to 1930s America with its mix of buildings steeped in old-fashioned charm. It’s smack, bang in the middle of the lively BoardWalk with picturesque views of the harbour and plenty of shops, bars and restaurants to explore. Kids will adore the swimming pool complex with its 61-metre water slide and white-sand beach, while adults can enjoy a leisurely swim in the quiet pool. It’s particularly fun to stay at Disney’s BoardWalk Inn as the whole area comes alive at night when duelling pianos get to work to the delight of the crowds, and everyone gets into the holiday mood. It’s dead easy to get to Epcot on the water taxi or by foot, and the restaurants of Disney’s Yacht Club and Disney’s Beach Club Resorts are close by for dining variety.
content.hotelDescription: This magical waterfront property will take you back to 1930s America with its mix of buildings steeped in old-fashioned charm.

content.name: Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress
content.virginView: There are far too many facilities at this marvellous 1,500-acre resort to detail here. The swimming pool is the kind that has kids gasping with wonder - waterfalls, grottos, whirlpools and a 124-ft long water slide tower, as well as a new water jet splash zone and rock climbing areas for kids, creates an aqueous wonderland. On the lake, you can practice kayaking, canoeing, or just simply pedal away toward the sunset. There is even a white sand beach for those waiting to sit back and relax, and 45 holes of top golf, with a pitch 'n' putt for non-golfers to enjoy. There are some great restaurants and bars; the pool bar, On the Rock, is located by Lake Windsong, offering views of the lake and the pool, four 60" TVs, a full service bar and food service options. Leave everything behind to enjoy the happiest of hours under palm tree canopies and moon-drenched evening skies at Four Flamingos, a Richard Blais Florida Kitchen that provides an immersive dining and drinking experience reminiscent of a dreamy, tropical oasis. Be one of the first to enjoy their newest recreational features: New Water slide, Water Jet Splash zone, rock climbing for kids and the pool bar!

content.name: Caribe Royale Orlando
content.virginView: Full to the brim with fun for all the family, the Caribe Royale is a spectacular resort in the theme park capital of the world. Just a short drive from some of Orlando’s best parks, you can be zipping around those rollercoasters before you know it. But it’s not all about the location. You’ve got pool complete with water slide, plus one for the kids. You have a choice of where to eat and drink all throughout the day and night, or opt for a night-in and enjoy room service in the comfort of your home-from-home. And when the nights roll in, you can put your feet up and watch some movies under the stars.

With a choice of nine restaurants and lounges from gourmet dining to deli fare, there's sure to be a dining option for all the family. Opposite the hotel is the Pointe Orlando with an array of shops, bars, restaurants and 21 cinema screens!

content.name: Universal Stella Nova Resort
content.virginView: There’s a New Star at Universal Orlando – and you can be amongst the first to try it out! Inspired by the infinite vastness of the unknown universe, where galaxies spiral ever outward and unknown worlds revolve around unnamed stars, Universal Stella Nova Resort, opening January 21, 2025, is your new gateway to Universal Orlando Resort. Here you can enjoy a whole host of fun with a resort-style swimming pool, poolside movies, a games room, and a range of delicious food on offer, from poolside cocktails to pizza delivery to your room! This resort is where you’ll take off for amazing adventures and exclusive theme park benefits at the parks; it’s also where you’ll touch down for relaxation and recharging between the fun. Offering great value for families, with complimentary transport to the parks, and easy access to the rest of International Drive, here you can dare to explore all that Universal Orlando has to offer.

content.name: Walt Disney World Swan Reserve
content.virginView: Recently opened in November 2021, the Walt Disney World Swan Reserve is an all-new, modern, boutique property within the Walt Disney World Swan and Dolphin complex. With one and two bedroom suites, there's oodles of room for groups and families, and floor-to-ceiling windows to grab the best views of the surrounding theme park land. You'll have your own restaurant, bar, swimming pool and health club, and what's more, you can take a short stroll over to the Swan and Dolphin hotels and use all the facilities on offer there too. And being just a quick walk or water taxi to Walt Disney World Resort itself, you can be on those adrenaline-fuelled rides before you know it.

content.name: Sheraton Vistana Resort
content.virginView: This 135-acre resort has an astonishing array of sporting opportunities including tennis and mini-golf, as well as several swimming pools and whirlpools in which to splash around. There are lots of organised activities, which we reckon doubles your fun and gives you the chance to meet new friends. Whether its the sports or the theme parks that have tired you out, why not treat yourself to a massage - you are on holiday after all! Dining choices include Zimmies, Azzula and Castaways. The apartments are attractively furnished, light and spacious, and the 2-Bedroom Apartments sleep up to 6 people.

content.name: Disney's Riviera Resort
content.virginView: Just like Disney’s classic fairy tales, this Disney Deluxe Villa Resort is inspired by the enchanting villages and romantic castles of Europe, with grand fountains, elegant socialising spaces, waterfront gardens, and rooftop dining that has the feel of a cliffside restaurant in Italy or the French Riviera. The self-catering studios and villas at Disney’s Riviera Resort let you mix days of park-hopping (with the Disney Skyliner Transportation giving you a bird’s eye view as it whisks you to Epcot and Disney’s Hollywood Studios) with days at the hotel’s relaxed Beau Soleil Pool or its fun family Riviera Pool, which features an interactive splash zone with a unique Fantasia spin.

content.name: Windsor Island
content.virginView: Built in 2020 and within touching distance of Walt Disney World Resort, Windsor Island offers the most up-to-date specs when it comes to villas surrounding the parks. An extravagant, modern clubhouse is house to a variety of activities and amenities; play a game of shuffleboard in the games room, grab an ice cream, or sit outdoors with a drink from the bar and soak up the warmth of the Sunshine state. The water park is sure to be a hit with the kids (and adults too!) – fly down the slides or float around the lazy river at a more chilled pace. Each of the villas are equipped with a private pool too, offering a quieter area to sunbathe with a good book. Close proximity to Walt Disney World Resort means you can visit as much or as little as you like, before retiring to your luxurious home at the end of the day for a good nights sleep.
atAGlance: Built in 2020

hotel.name: Fairfield Inn - In Marriott Village at Lake Buena Vista

content.name: Fairfield Inn - In Marriott Village at Lake Buena Vista
content.virginView: The Marriott Village is a wonderful combination of 3 quality hotels in 1 resort, giving you the benefit of facilities at all 3 hotels for 1 great price! Each hotel gives you a different experience, with the Fairfield Inn providing a quality stay for those looking for great value. And If somebody was to offer you a hotel that provides complimentary breakfast and is just 3 minutes drive from Walt Disney World, with a complimentary shuttle to drop you to the door, it would sound too good to be true. It’s not – it’s here! The bunk beds in the family suites will be a hit with the kids, as will the games room and outdoor pool for those moments when you’re not out exploring in the parks. The superb dining and entertainment choices of Disney Springs are only minutes away, and it’s not just great for Disney, you're close to all the attractions on International Drive and a short hop from the Orlando outlets.

Each hotel gives you a different experience, with the Fairfield Inn providing a quality stay for those looking for great value, the Courtyard by Marriott offering a higher standard of furnishings and comfort, while the SpringHill Suites have more of a studio apartment feel with a combined bedroom and living area.

content.name: Loews Portofino Bay Hotel at Universal Orlando
content.virginView: Experience la dolce vita — the sweet life — at Loews Portofino Bay at Universal Orlando. Set on a stunning harbour, prepare to be transported to the charming, picturesque Italian seaside and cobblestoned streets. Sit and enjoy the views over the glistening harbour waters while sipping on a coffee. Taste traditional Italian food in one of the many restaurants. And, when the sun’s shining, jump into one of the pools to cool off. The parks are only a water taxi or shuttle bus away, and you’ll benefit from amazing extras such as FREE** Universal Express Unlimited ride access, allowing you to skip the regular lines in Universal Studios Florida and Universal’s Islands of Adventure all day (Valid theme park admission required) and Early Park Admission† to The Wizarding World of Harry Potter™ and Universal’s Volcano Bay.

content.virginView: This development of 160 luxurious condos is a new expansion to the well-established Vista Cay resort in Orlando. Situated on Lake Cay and featuring luxury finishes, open floor plans, and modern interiors, these condos provide stylish accommodation just a short drive from both Walt Disney World and Universal Studios. The communal resort area features two pools - one with an infinity edge overlooking the lake - as well as a sundries shop, 24-hour reception desk, and a bar and restaurant with a daily happy hour.

content.name: Sonesta ES Suites Orlando - Lake Buena Vista
content.virginView: Combining spacious suites with a fantastic location, and great value for money, the Sonesta ES Suites Lake Buena Vista will be a hit with parties of all sizes. You’re just a mile from the Walt Disney World entrance, so you can be hitting those thrills in no time, but you’ve also got plenty of facilities and space in your own suite should you wish to just chill out with a takeaway for the evening, or have a family BBQ. For the breakfast lovers, feel right at home with a hearty breakfast from the new Morning Pour cafe. Self-parking is complimentary for Virgin Atlantic Holidays customers, and guests can jump on the shuttle service to nearby parks for a small daily fee - ideal for saving on parking! The friendly staff will be happy to point you in the direction of local restaurants in walking distance too, of which there are plenty! However, with the fully equipped kitchen you can also whip up your own meals in no time. And when you’re hot and tired from a day exploring all that Orlando has to offer, the outdoor pool will be very welcome for a refreshing dip!

content.name: Solara
content.virginView: Ideally suited for large groups of families and friends, the Solara resort is a fun-filled resort that will take your vacation to another level. You can choose to do as little or as much as you like here, simply lay by your private pool with a good book and get some Vitamin D, or make use of the fantastic amenities on offer. The large clubhouse hosts a bar and grill witih an open-air terrace, great for catching up over a cocktail whilst the kids splash around in the pool. Or if you’re feeling a bit more active, there’s a range of sports on offer that everybody can get involved in. The villas have a light, welcoming ambience and are fully equipped with all you need for a comfortable stay, with great kitchens to bring out the chef in you. You’re in the perfect location to pop out to I-Drive or Disney Springs for a bite to eat though, and of course, the parks are practically on your doorstep if you fancy a few more thrills.
atAGlance: 3 to 8 bedroom townhouses and villas
18-acre complex with a range of amenities
Just 8 miles from Walt Disney World Resort

content.name: Universal Terra Luna Resort
content.virginView: This new Universal hotel is out of this world, pushing the limits of discovery and stepping into new landscapes. Opening on 25 February 2025, this is your launchpad into amazing adventures at the parks of Universal Orlando; but it’s also your landing zone for relaxation and recharging between the fun. With terrestrial tones and a spaceship inspired window in your room, you’ll feel like you’re exploring even when you are back at base, with plenty of storage to keep your luggage stowed away. Head down to the pool area for a bite to eat, cool off with the pop-up jets, or relax in the hot tub – you’ll need it in between the thrill of the rides. Enjoy exclusive theme park benefits at this great value hotel, inspired by the thrill of exploring the unknown.

content.name: Renaissance Orlando at SeaWorld
content.virginView: This plush hotel has a wide variety of facilities and activities including the R Aqua Zone, an interactive waterpark with two waterslides as well as two splash and play areas. There is an incredible choice of restaurants on site — ranging from fresh seafood to great steaks. Kids will love the play area, while adults can have fun in the Boardwalk Sports Bar.

content.name: Regal Oaks
content.virginView: Welcome to Regal Oaks, a home-from home gated community offering space, comfort and privacy for you to enjoy your Florida holiday at your own pace. Located in an ideal setting, just a few miles away from the world-famous theme parks, you have no excuse not to get out and explore the fun and thrills that Orlando has to offer. After an adventure filled day, head back to your townhouse to soak up the evening sun by the pool or relax with a cooled drink on your private terrace. You will be spoilt for choice come dinner time, rustle up a storm in your fully-equipped kitchen or head out to one of the local restaurants to dine on some delicious American favourites. Fancy something a little closer to home? The resorts own bar and grill offers freshly made meals any time of the day and some tempting cocktails.

content.virginView: An all-suite, modern and classic property in the heart of Orlando, Buena Vista Suites is the perfect spot for a fun-filled few days or weeks at the theme parks. There's some great perks at this hotel that will allow you to save a few pennies to use on souvenirs - complimentary full American breakfast will give you much needed fuel in the morning before a day at the theme parks, which are a short complimentary shuttle ride away, so you can be walking through those park gates in minutes! And when you’re ready for some down time, you’ve got an outdoor pool as well as access to the facilities and dining at next door Caribe Royal Orlando!

content.name: Encore Resort at Reunion
content.virginView: Imagine all the privacy of a premium home mixed with all the buzz of a big resort — that’s what’s in store at Encore Resort at Reunion. Enjoy your own exclusive Floridian home, with up to 8 bedrooms and that all-essential private pool — all delivered with a gleaming high-end polish. Alongside its three eateries, convenience market, fitness centre, and home delivery service, it lays on entertainment that ranges from upmarket wine tasting to fun family cannon ball competitions. But it’s the AquaPark that adds the ultimate excitement, packing in a lagoon pool, thrilling water slides, and the Surfin’ Safari kids’ splash area.
content.hotelDescription: Imagine all the privacy of a premium home mixed with all the buzz of a big resort — that’s what’s in store at Encore Resort at Reunion. It doesn’t just give you your own exclusive Floridian home, with up to 8 bedrooms and that all-essential private pool — all delivered with a gleaming high-end polish — it also has it's own AquaPark complete with thrilling water slides.

Well-kept lawns, a gym, and tennis and volleyball courts are all within the grounds here, and that’s before you step into your villa. You’ll have a private pool, a games room, and all the things you’d expect to find in the perfect home away from home.

content.name: Courtyard Orlando Lake Buena Vista in the Marriott Village
content.virginView: The Marriott Village is a wonderful combination of 3 quality hotels in 1 resort, giving you the benefit of facilities at all 3 hotels for 1 great price! Each hotel gives you a different experience, with the Courtyard by Marriott offering a high standard of furnishings and comfort. As a Walt Disney World Good Neighbor® Hotel, it couldn’t be easier for you to plan your trip to see Mickey, with a free shuttle service available to selected parks. However, should you choose to stay on-site for the day, there are plentiful dining options and both indoor and outdoor pools to suit any weather.
content.hotelDescription: The Marriott Village is a wonderful combination of 3 quality hotels in 1 resort, giving you the benefit of facilities at all 3 hotels for 1 great price! Each hotel gives you a different experience, with the Fairfield Inn providing a quality stay for those looking for great value, the Courtyard by Marriott offering a higher standard of furnishings and comfort, while the SpringHill Suites have more of a studio apartment feel with a combined bedroom and living area.

content.name: Wyndham Orlando Celebration Area
content.virginView: For great value, family-friendly accommodation within a stones throw of Walt Disney World, look no further than the recently remodelled Wyndham Orlando Celebration Area – showing that you don’t necessarily need to book an on-site hotel to be in the heart of the action. The hotel includes a complimentary shuttle service to Walt Disney World (the short trip that it is!) as well as Universtal Studios and even the Lake Buena Vista outlets when you want a break from the thrills and spills. Start your day with the fabulous waffles that are on offer at the H Street Grille buffet breakfast, grab a Starbucks from the lobby, and you’ll be all set for wherever you’re heading. There’s no need to leave if you don’t want to though, chill by the pool or let the little ones roam in the indoor play area – you’ll find it hard to tear them away! If it’s the older ones that are looking for some action, book a session at the Topgolf swing suites, you don’t need to be a golf fan to enjoy yourself here, there’s no experience required!
atAGlance: Complimentary scheduled transportation to Walt Disney World Resort®, Universal Studios, and Lake Buena Vista outlets
Topgolf® Swing Suite

Or you can opt to spend the day at home with your private pool, and plenty of fun stuff for all the family to enjoy.

content.name: Margaritaville Cottages Orlando
content.virginView: This island inspired resort is situated in an excellent location, near to Walt Disney World Resort and Universal Orlando Resort™, so you’re as close to the action as can be. And if you’re travelling in a group, or you enjoy a little more peace and privacy, the holiday cottages are relaxing retreats that will offer you all of the resort facilities, with the seclusion of your own space. Between daily and nightly entertainment, family activities at the Fins Up Beach Club and splashing around in the pools, you will never be short of things to do. The cottages are complete with full kitchens so you can enjoy family dinner on the patio at your own pace. If you’re looking to take it easy then grab a bite at the resorts exceptional restaurants and try Florida’s famed seafood, or load up on snacks for long days out at the theme parks. Whether you want a fun packed adventure or just the chance to slow life down and chill out, you’ll be able to have your holiday your way.

content.name: Ritz Carlton Orlando Grande Lakes
content.virginView: At The Ritz-Carlton Orlando Grande Lakes, you can take in the ambience of Orlando with a helping of utter sophistication. This hotel offers plenty of opportunities for fun, sport and pampering, without ever having to leave this 500-acre resort. There's a wide selection of on-site activities on offer, with an 18-hole Championship golf course, 40,000 sq ft spa and adventure experiences including fly fishing, eco-tours and kayaking. There is a choice of 11 restaurants and bars offering guests a unique culinary experience. Guest rooms are furnished and fitted to the highest standards and each of the sumptuous bedrooms has a 5ft balcony with panoramic view over the lake, pool or gardens. The resort is located minutes away from world-famous attractions such as Walt Disney World® Resort and Universal Orlando Resort™.

content.name: Windsor at Westside
content.virginView: Windsor at Westside resort is based in the Kissimee and Davenport area - a short drive to the adrenaline-filled theme parks, and outlet malls. With a load of activities for all the family, you'll be spoilt for choice, even if you decide to have a day of relaxing. There's swimming pools (including your own private one if you’ve booked a villa!), waterslides, a lazy river, or a range of sports courts to run off steam. And when you want to be whizzing round those theme park rides, jump in your car and you’ll be there in no time. The well-equipped homes offer great comfort away from your own home, and offer plenty of space to cook up a storm for an evening in, in front of the TV. Alternatively, head to the clubhouse for a bite to eat or a drink by the fire after a busy day.
atAGlance: 4 to 8 bedroom townhouses and villas

content.name: Storey Lake
content.virginView: Staying in one of the amazing villas or townhouses at Storey Lake will be a sure-fire hit with larger groups and families. With activities on-site from mini-golf to water slides, there really is something for everyone. Your property comes complete with a private screened pool or plunge pool for chilled days and evenings at home. When it's time to head to the theme parks, you're just a short drive away, so you'll be walking through those grand gates in minutes!

hotel.name: Four Seasons Resort Orlando at Walt Disney World Resort

content.name: Four Seasons Resort Orlando
content.virginView: Located inside the gates of Orlando’s Walt Disney World® Resort, Four Seasons Resort Orlando at Walt Disney World® Resort combines legendary Four Seasons hospitality with an unforgettable Walt Disney World® experience. Discover a world of fun and adventure at the 5-acre Explorer Island water park, spend an afternoon drifting along the lazy river, or enjoy some quality time together in the family pool. With 30ft water blasts, fog nozzles and jet sprays, the interactive Splash Zone is the perfect way for little ones to cool off from the hot Florida sunshine. If you’ve worked up an appetite after all that outdoor fun, Four Seasons Resort Orlando has the perfect selection of restaurants to help keep the hunger at bay! Enjoy the rooftop Spanish steakhouse, Capa, or Southern inspired PB&G, to satisfy cravings. At Ravello, you'll find fresh tasty dishes cooked the authentic Italian way. For light bites and refreshments, café Lickety Split is one of several delicious possibilities! To relax, mums and dads can take a dip in the adults-only pool or pay a visit to the luxurious on-site spa. With no less than 18 treatment rooms, 6 couples rooms, and a separate beauty salon, you’ll never be short of ways to indulge!
content.hotelDescription: Located inside the gates of Orlando’s Walt Disney World® Resort, Four Seasons Resort Orlando at Walt Disney World® Resort combines legendary Four Seasons hospitality with an unforgettable Disney experience.
atAGlance: Central Florida's only AAA Five Diamond Award property
5-acre Explorer Island with pools, splash pad and lazy river

content.virginView: Looking for a family getaway to Walt Disney World? Look no further. These modern, luxury villas are within 5 miles of both Disney's Hollywood Studios and Animal Kingdom, making it easier than ever to enjoy the parks with your friends and family. The villas have a modern look, and the community has a concierge service on hand to ensure your holiday goes as planned. When you're having some down time from the rides, the pool and hot tub will be a welcome retreat in that Florida sunshine!
atAGlance: Luxury community with 3 and 4 bedroom villas

content.name: Legacy Park
content.virginView: One of the more popular Davenport villa communities, Legacy Park is divided into four villages. All villas come complete with screened-in porch and swimming pool - great for cooling off in after soaking up the Floridian sun. Fully air-conditioned, choose between 3-, 4- or 5-Bedroom Villas, each with a full American-sized kitchen, at least one separate living area. On US 27, close to the I-4, you are minutes from all attractions, including the Disney theme parks and popular Champions Gate Golf Complex. There are also several supermarkets close by, handy for keeping your cupboards stocked. A great choice for a family or groups of friends, you’ll enjoy returning home to Legacy Park at the end of each day.
content.hotelDescription: One of the more popular Davenport villa communities, Legacy Park is divided into four villages. All villas come complete with screened-in porch and swimming pool - great for cooling off in after soaking up the Floridian sun.

content.name: Solterra
content.virginView: A private community in a peaceful spot, Solterra is a great home-from-home. With fun for all ages, from kids to big kids alike, there’s a resort-style pool, fitness centre, tennis court, and a kids’ playground. And that’s all before you head into your villa or townhouse. With a private pool or plunge pool, a full kitchen and a dining area, there’s enough here that you don’t have to leave. But if you do, you’re within 12 miles of the theme parks, meaning it’s just minutes to the adrenaline-fueled fun.

content.name: Orlando World Centre Marriott
content.virginView: An iconic Orlando resort just 1.5 miles from Walt Disney World, the Orlando World Center Marriott has fun-for-all down to a tee.  Whizz down 7 thrilling waterslides, and take a dip in our 400,000 gallon lagoon pool or float your worries away in our 575-foot lazy river.  Little explorers will enjoy a space designed just for them while the adults will taste tropical libations hand crafted and delivered right to their pool chair.  Treat yourself to some R&R in the spa, or tee up a round of golf, both just steps from your room.  Dine in 10 unique outlets, including a grab and go pantry, and a lively sports pub plus monthly culinary special events.  Getting to the magic is easy with our scheduled shuttle service and you are just a short drive away from shopping, dining and nightlife.  Whatever adventures you are seeking on your next getaway, make Orlando World Center Marriott your destination.
content.hotelDescription: An oasis right next to Walt Disney World, the Orlando World Center Marriott has fun-for-all down to a tee.
atAGlance: 5-minute drive to Walt Disney World Resort, with transport included in the resort fee

content.name: JW Marriott Orlando Bonnett Creek
content.virginView: When you’re booking a trip to the theme parks in Orlando, you don’t imagine that you’d be able to find a haven of relaxation and luxury right in the centre – well here it is. The JW Marriott Orlando Bonnet Creek Resort & Spa sits within the gates of Walt Disney World Resort, with a shuttle service taking you to the park gates in no time at all. The action is right around you, but when you step into the resort you’l find yourself in a 75-acre protected oasis where you can recuperate. The rooms have a sleek, sophisticated design, with ample space in the family suites for larger groups. And from the family suite accommodations to the rock climbing, garden golf, and the activity schedule at the kids club, there’s always something to keep the little ones entertained, rain or shine, whatever their hobbies. Whilst they’re occupied in resort, be sure to visit the spa by JW, inspired by the rejuvenating warmth of the ‘Sunshine State’, these treatments will have you feeling your best in no time. Disney Springs is just 5 miles away, with its wide variety of restaurants and bars on offer, but the JW Marriott have plenty of their own to save you the trip on those tired evenings. illume is a particular favourite for guests, located on the 9th floor, giving you a great vantage point for the Disney fireworks whilst enjoying Asian inspired tapas and fresh sushi. For those chilled poolside afternoons, check out the happy hour at Unreserved Beer Garden, where you can enjoy a range of craft beers or a chilled glass of rose in the late afternoon sun.
atAGlance: Within the gates of Walt Disney World Resort, with fireworks view from the roof terrace
9,920 sq ft luxury spa
Complimentary shuttle service to Walt Disney World Resort

content.name: Providence Golf & Country Club
content.virginView: Set within a beautiful golf location, Providence Homes offer guests a home-from-home base from which to explore Orlando and its many attractions. Every residence is furnished to a high standard with fully-equipped kitchens, TVs in all rooms and plenty of living space for the whole family to enjoy. There’s also a gorgeous swimming pool with screened-in porch and large covered area to cool off in after a busy day. If you’re a golf fan, you’re in luck, a Championship 18-hole golf course, designed by Michael Dasher and possibly one of the finest in Central Florida is quite literally on your doorstep. There’s an impressive clubhouse too, complete with pro shop, lounge bar and restaurant with expansive outdoor terrace overlooking the driving range. Other facilities include 2 swimming pools, one resort-style with water slides and a play area, the other a lap pool for the more serious swimmer. Both pools have plenty of sun loungers and expansive views of the golf course and putting green. In the adjacent recreation centre there is a well-equipped gym and children’s activity area, whilst outside there’s floodlit tennis courts where you can arrange lessons from a professional if you wish!
content.hotelDescription: A brand new holiday village set within a beautiful golf location, Providence Homes offer guests a luxurious home-from-home base from which to explore Orlando and its many attractions.
atAGlance: 4 bedroom villas, all with private pool
On-site golf coursewith clubhouse, restaurant and lounge

content.name: Spectrum Resort Orlando
content.virginView: When travelling to Orlando as a group, an apartment can be a great option to get value for money, and all be able to stay and have fun together! The newly opened Spectrum Resort offers you just this - a home-from-home, but with added luxury. This resort is perfect for families, foodies, and golf enthusiasts alike - with 3 PGA golf courses, access to 5 acres of fun-filled attractions at Reunion Water Park, and a huge array of bars and restaurants. The apartments feel spacious and modern, with open-plan layouts, fully equipped kitchens, and outdoor spaces to enjoy al fresco dining. You're even able to arrange in-house chef and bartender experiences to do all the work for you! A golf buggy is on hand to transport you around the huge resort when needed, and there's a complimentary shuttle service to take you to Walt Disney World Resort for even more excitement. It's a good job the apartment beds are comfy, you'll be tired after enjoying everything Orlando has to offer!
atAGlance: Modern apartments in Kissimmee
